intro: Galactites tomentosus, commonly known as the hairy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. Galactites tomentosus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
